review: I'm a DirecTV customer and already subscribe to HBO,  Showtime and Pandora.  I'm also a Netflix subscriber with access through my blu ray player.  So as I suspected, other than some Amazon Prime movies and shows not yet available on Netflix, the Fire Stick doesn't give me a lot more content that I'm likely to watch beyond what I already had.  But it was cheap, so I thought I'd give it a shot.It was very easy to install and set up took about two minutes.  The interface is clunky.  Amazon should have studied Apple, not Netflix.About the biggest plus, besides some Prime content not available on Netflix, is I can now look at my vacation photos on my tv rather than just my computer, tablets and phone.  I'm sure my guests will be thrilled.Not much ventured, not much gained.

review: The Amazon Fire Tv Stick works great. I pluged it in and in a few minutes it was up and running on my Sony LED TV. It took only a few minutes to connect to my Linksys Router which is 32' away. Have had it for about a month now and no problems using it. So if you are thinking about buying a smart tv look into the Amazon Fire TV Stick first, you may fine it to be your best choice. Also I have found that after about 4 hours of use it does get a little warm to touch, other than that it's your best buy.
author: Russell

review: The fire tv stick works pretty well, though it is designed to push out Amazon content. You have to go to the apps section to find Netflix, HBOgo, etc.  The main issue I have and the reason I only gave it 3 stars is it is not supported by all cable companies. I happen to have charter cable here in the Midwest and my roku worked perfectly until it had a housekeeping mishap. So I replaced it with the fire tv stick because I figured it would do the same thing as my roku but$10 cheaper. Well, that was a mistake. I tried to install hbo go and a couple of others and they are not supported by charter cable. It just recommends contacting your cable company.  Well we all know how that's going to end. So if you want to watch hbo go or sho anytime, make sure your cable company supports it before you order. Or, just order a roku.
